resolvers.name: att
resolvers.description: AT&T test DoH server.

resolvers.name: dnshome-doh
resolvers.description: https://www.dnshome.de/ public resolver in Germany

resolvers.name: dnspod-doh
resolvers.description:
A public DNS resolver in mainland China provided by DNSPod (Tencent Cloud).
https://www.dnspod.cn/Products/Public.DNS?lang=en

resolvers.name: doh-cleanbrowsing-adult
resolvers.description:
Blocks access to all adult, pornographic and explicit sites. It does
not block proxy or VPNs, nor mixed-content sites. Sites like Reddit
are allowed. Google and Bing are set to the Safe Mode.
By https://cleanbrowsing.org/

resolvers.name: doh-cleanbrowsing-family
resolvers.description:
Blocks access to all adult, pornographic and explicit sites. It also
blocks proxy and VPN domains that are used to bypass the filters.
Mixed content sites (like Reddit) are also blocked. Google, Bing and
Youtube are set to the Safe Mode.
By https://cleanbrowsing.org/

resolvers.name: doh-cleanbrowsing-security
resolvers.description:
Block access to phishing, malware and malicious domains. It does not block adult content.
By https://cleanbrowsing.org/

resolvers.name: doh-ibksturm
resolvers.description:
DoH & DoT Server, No Logging, No Filters, DNSSEC
Running privately by ibksturm in Thurgau, Switzerland

resolvers.name: nextdns-ultralow
resolvers.description:
NextDNS is a cloud-based private DNS service that gives you full control
over what is allowed and what is blocked on the Internet.
https://www.nextdns.io/
To select the server location, the "-ultralow" variant relies on bootstrap servers
instead of anycast.

resolvers.name: odoh-cloudflare
resolvers.description:
Cloudflare ODoH server.
https://cloudflare.com

resolvers.name: odoh-id-gmail
resolvers.description:
ODoH target server. Based in Singapore, no logs.
Filter ads, trackers and malware.

resolvers.name: odoh-jp.tiarap.org
resolvers.description: ODoH target server via Cloudflare, no logs.

resolvers.name: odoh-koki-ams
resolvers.description: Oblivious DoH target server in The Netherlands. No logs, No filter, DNSSEC.

resolvers.name: odoh-koki-es
resolvers.description: Oblivious DoH target server in Spain. No logs, No filter, DNSSEC.

resolvers.name: odoh-koki-noads-ams
resolvers.description: Oblivious DoH target server in The Netherlands. No logs, filter ads and malware, DNSSEC.

resolvers.name: odoh-koki-noads-se
resolvers.description: Oblivious DoH target server in Sweden. No logs, filter ads and malware, DNSSEC.

resolvers.name: odoh-koki-se
resolvers.description: Oblivious DoH target server in Sweden. No logs, No filter, DNSSEC.

resolvers.name: odoh-resolver4.dns.openinternet.io
resolvers.description:
ODoH target server. no logs, no filter, DNSSEC.
Running on dedicated hardware colocated at Sonic.net in Santa Rosa, CA in the United States.
Uses Sonic's recusrive DNS servers as upstream resolvers (but is not affiliated with Sonic
in any way). Provided by https://openinternet.io

resolvers.name: odoh-tiarap.org
resolvers.description:
ODoH target server via Cloudflare, no logs.
Filter ads, trackers and malware.

resolvers.name: quad101
resolvers.description:
DNSSEC-aware public resolver by the Taiwan Network Information Center (TWNIC)
https://101.101.101.101/index_en.html

resolvers.name: safesurfer-doh
resolvers.description:
Family safety focused blocklist for over 2 million adult sites, as well as phishing and malware and more.
Free to use, paid for customizing blocking for more categories+sites and viewing usage at my.safesurfer.io. Logs taken for viewing
usage, data never sold - https://safesurfer.io

resolvers.name: switch
resolvers.description:
Public DoH service provided by SWITCH in Switzerland
https://www.switch.ch
Provides protection against malware, but does not block ads.
